commit_message:
Enable audit pipeline for heat

This change adds the keystonemiddleware audit paste filter[0]
and enables it for the heat-api, heat-cfn, and heat-cloudwatch
services. This provides the ability to audit API requests
for heat.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/audit.html

Change-Id: Ib5a7dfd882416553ff6f43aa009e3e67871d7f4c

commit_message:
Enable audit pipeline for neutron

This change adds the keystonemiddleware audit paste filter[0]
and enables it for the neutron-server service.
This provides the ability to audit API requests for neutron.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/audit.html

Change-Id: I86b4df1436ae59bc9a151c28337af7c06c83e45f

commit_message:
Enable audit pipeline for cinder

This change adds the keystonemiddleware audit paste filter[0]
and enables it for the cinder-api and cinder-scheduler services.
This provides the ability to audit API requests for cinder.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/audit.html

Change-Id: If81b88a4003bc4394ef4a378626cf5d6edb9c4ae

commit_message:
Check if source directory does exist before linking

If Ansible runs in dry-run mode (ie with the "--check" arg) it will not
create the /var/log/swift directory, and thus a subsequent task to
create a link to it will fail.

Closes-Bug: 1800457
Change-Id: Ia84f979b5f8d07dfc8b6cd162e1491bbea95c5d7
(cherry picked from commit 618229e7dcc31ad945d9c9f1bc70a9bffe6cec0d)

subject: SPEC: unset project extra keys
messages:
[{'account_id': 23382, 'date': '2017-07-27 10:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-27 10:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-keystone-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/04/487804/1/check/gate-keystone-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/4134389//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 39s
- gate-keystone-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/04/487804/1/check/gate-keystone-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/02269f0/ : SUCCESS in 2m 44s'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-07-27 10:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We strongly discourage any use of the extras column at all - see https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1576765

We will soon have similar functionality with tags, which will be deleteable - see http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/pike/project-tags.html. I would make use of that rather than try to enhance extras.'}, {'account_id': 17860, 'date': '2017-10-06 14:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Mostly agree with Colleen, but allowing one to delete those extra fields without needing to go to the db directly would be good'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-10-20 15:54:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with Colleen here. Would project tags work for your usecases? 

I'm also not sure about developing a way to delete project extras, because it seems like a one-off way to move to project tags.

http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/project-tags.html"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-04-12 23:33:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Artem, do you have any thoughts about our suggestion to use project tags, which have now been implemented? Is this still a feature you want to work on?'}]

'}]

messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-11 19:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-12 05:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-04-12 07:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nFor the record and my memory, this was done due to most OpenStack-Ansible roles, which are branched but not tagged.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-12 23:08:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-11 19:10:48.000000000', 'message': 'new-release: Handle em for untagged repos

This updates the new-release command to use the last release for normal
repos when transitioning to -em, but grabbing the current HEAD when
tagging "release-model: untagged" deliverables.

Change-Id: I42acb74d033429a72946fda136f87b4ccaefb220
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
new-release: Handle em for untagged repos

This updates the new-release command to use the last release for normal
repos when transitioning to -em, but grabbing the current HEAD when
tagging "release-model: untagged" deliverables.

Change-Id: I42acb74d033429a72946fda136f87b4ccaefb220
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Kolla doesn't follow the stable policy (which is designed for service/libraries not deployment projects).  I do want to at least discuss the addition of a new python requirement and if that means a minor bump (as opposed to patch).

AFAICT this is the same for rocky and queens."}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-04-12 06:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-12 08:09:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Kolla doesn't follow the stable policy (which is designed for
 > service/libraries not deployment projects).  I do want to at least
 > discuss the addition of a new python requirement and if that means
 > a minor bump (as opposed to patch).
 > 
 > AFAICT this is the same for rocky and queens.

I think you're referring to this:

jmespath>=0.9.3 # MIT

I'm open to using a minor bump. I wasn't sure which to go for. There's probably an argument for always using a minor bump for kolla (images, not kolla-ansible), since there's almost certainly something in one of the images that has been minor bumped.

I'm trying to write up some of the kolla processes currently since they do differ somewhat from the rest of OpenStack. Version bumping policies might be a good thing to include. How to apply SemVer to something that depends in some ways on everything else is non-trivial."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-12 08:10:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-12 16:09:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

 > they do differ somewhat from the rest of OpenStack. Version bumping
 > policies might be a good thing to include. How to apply SemVer to
 > something that depends in some ways on everything else is
 > non-trivial.

Thanks, that could be very useful."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-12 23:06:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 08:24:45.000000000', 'message': 'Tag ocata-em for openstack-ansible repos

This case is a little special, so here is the justifications:
openstack-ansible-security has been deprecated and replaced
by ansible-hardening. Ocata branch is already non-taggable anymore.
To pass validation and prevent the branch from being recreated,
references to that repo have been removed.

Next to this, OpenStack-Ansible roles haven't been tagged since we
decided to stop tagging them. Using the last tags for EM look
inappropriate, as it doesn't carry the meaning of EM at the first
place ("From this on, you are on your own"). This would be just
fine by reusing OpenStack-Ansible latest role shas (current
HEAD of their ocata branch).

The OpenStack-Ansible main repo last tag could have been
used for the EM. However, this last tag is broken, due to an
external factor (some external git repo changed its versionning).
Instead of using a broken tag for EM, I am here asking for
using HEAD instead, exceptionally.

Change-Id: I0d471c38841611bf08c3f31aad698bf0f7e3e412
'}]
commit_message:
Tag ocata-em for openstack-ansible repos

This case is a little special, so here is the justifications:
openstack-ansible-security has been deprecated and replaced
by ansible-hardening. Ocata branch is already non-taggable anymore.
To pass validation and prevent the branch from being recreated,
references to that repo have been removed.

Next to this, OpenStack-Ansible roles haven't been tagged since we
decided to stop tagging them. Using the last tags for EM look
inappropriate, as it doesn't carry the meaning of EM at the first
place ("From this on, you are on your own"). This would be just
fine by reusing OpenStack-Ansible latest role shas (current
HEAD of their ocata branch).

The OpenStack-Ansible main repo last tag could have been
used for the EM. However, this last tag is broken, due to an
external factor (some external git repo changed its versionning).
Instead of using a broken tag for EM, I am here asking for
using HEAD instead, exceptionally.

Change-Id: I0d471c38841611bf08c3f31aad698bf0f7e3e412

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 15:10:48.000000000', 'message': 'Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py
      nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The (test_)request_spec.py conflicts are due to not
having change I2131558f0edfe603ee1e8d8bae66a3caf5182a58 in Queens.
test_save_does_not_persist_requested_fields from that change is
ported and modified here to just deal with the ignore_hosts field.
The test_conductor.py conflict is due to not having change
I640562b8dd049ff5b6fea9286dc3082b9d837ed3 in Queens.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit e4c998e57390c15891131205f7443fee98dde4ee)

(cherry picked from commit 31c08d0c7dc73bb2eefc69fa0f014b6478f3d149)

commit_message:
Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py
      nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The (test_)request_spec.py conflicts are due to not
having change I2131558f0edfe603ee1e8d8bae66a3caf5182a58 in Queens.
test_save_does_not_persist_requested_fields from that change is
ported and modified here to just deal with the ignore_hosts field.
The test_conductor.py conflict is due to not having change
I640562b8dd049ff5b6fea9286dc3082b9d837ed3 in Queens.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit e4c998e57390c15891131205f7443fee98dde4ee)
(cherry picked from commit 76dfb9d0b6cee1bbb553d3ec11139ca99a6f9474)
(cherry picked from commit 31c08d0c7dc73bb2eefc69fa0f014b6478f3d149)

Add functional regression test for bug 1669054

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts value.
This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only a few
compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an evacuation
can fail if the only available host is the one being ignored.

This adds a functional regression recreate test for the bug.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-05 20:28:18.000000000', 'message': 'Delete allocations even if _confirm_resize raises

When we are confirming a resize, the guest is on the dest
host and the instance host/node values in the database
are pointing at the dest host, so the _confirm_resize method
on the source is really best effort. If something fails, we
should not leak allocations in placement for the source compute
node resource provider since the instance is not actually
consuming the source node provider resources.

This change refactors the error handling around the _confirm_resize
call so the big nesting for _error_out_instance_on_exception is
moved to confirm_resize and then a try/finally is added around
_confirm_resize so we can be sure to try and cleanup the allocations
even if _confirm_resize fails in some obscure way. If _confirm_resize
does fail, the error gets re-raised along with logging a traceback
and hint about how to correct the instance state in the DB by hard
rebooting the server on the dest host.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I49034f87e240775cca7a4d769819dd788b86832a in Stein.

Change-Id: I29c5f491ec20a71283190a1599e7732541de736f
Closes-Bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 03a6d26691c1f182224d59190b79f48df278099e)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete allocations even if _confirm_resize raises

When we are confirming a resize, the guest is on the dest
host and the instance host/node values in the database
are pointing at the dest host, so the _confirm_resize method
on the source is really best effort. If something fails, we
should not leak allocations in placement for the source compute
node resource provider since the instance is not actually
consuming the source node provider resources.

This change refactors the error handling around the _confirm_resize
call so the big nesting for _error_out_instance_on_exception is
moved to confirm_resize and then a try/finally is added around
_confirm_resize so we can be sure to try and cleanup the allocations
even if _confirm_resize fails in some obscure way. If _confirm_resize
does fail, the error gets re-raised along with logging a traceback
and hint about how to correct the instance state in the DB by hard
rebooting the server on the dest host.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I49034f87e240775cca7a4d769819dd788b86832a in Stein.

Change-Id: I29c5f491ec20a71283190a1599e7732541de736f
Closes-Bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 03a6d26691c1f182224d59190b79f48df278099e)

[{'created': '2019-04-02 18:33:07.000000000', 'message': 'Error out migration when confirm_resize fails

If anything fails and raises an exception during
confirm_resize, the migration status is stuck in
"confirming" status even though the instance status
may be "ERROR".

This change adds the errors_out_migration decorator
to the confirm_resize method to make sure the migration
status is "error" if an error is raised.

In bug 1821594 it was the driver.confirm_migration
method that raised some exception, so a unit test is
added here which simulates a similar scenario.

This only partially closes the bug because we are still
leaking allocations on the source node resource provider
since _delete_allocation_after_move is not called. That
will be dealt with in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ic7d78ad43a2bad7f932c22c98944accbbed9e9e2
Partial-Bug: #1821594

commit_message:
Error out migration when confirm_resize fails

If anything fails and raises an exception during
confirm_resize, the migration status is stuck in
"confirming" status even though the instance status
may be "ERROR".

This change adds the errors_out_migration decorator
to the confirm_resize method to make sure the migration
status is "error" if an error is raised.

In bug 1821594 it was the driver.confirm_migration
method that raised some exception, so a unit test is
added here which simulates a similar scenario.

This only partially closes the bug because we are still
leaking allocations on the source node resource provider
since _delete_allocation_after_move is not called. That
will be dealt with in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ic7d78ad43a2bad7f932c22c98944accbbed9e9e2
Partial-Bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 408ef8f84a698f764aa5d769d6d01fd9340de2e5)

this needs more information in the message and/or a bug/spec associated with it.

We have discussed this in the past (previous) meetings and generally view custom project_id problematic for a number of reasons:

1) Keystone must own the data, and this now allows potential conflicts in IDs. IDs are immutable and cannot be changed the life of the project

2) Limited storage space for the ID field. This does not set proper limits in the schema to ensure that errors are not generated when a "too long string" is specified for the ID.

In general I am a strong -2 on this change based upon the previous discussions within the keystone team. Keystone should own/create the IDs for any backends it is writing to. These should be automatic and conform to known standards so that other projects can store the IDs and be assured that the form is correct (nova for example).'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-28 23:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

My concern about this is that for multiregion installations it creates two types of token: global and local. Global are verifiable everywhere and local are verifiable only in local region. Global tokens are only project- and domain-scoped tokens. Local tokens are all other scopes.

Although global and local tokens look the same, they have different functionality. And this difference will be only documented in human text and won't be reflected in code.

Today, when a token is received from keystone, we expect it to be valid, unless something has changed (revocation or too much time has passed). If we get 401 for our token, we just know that something has changed and try to reauthenticate. If auth fails, we can no longer do a thing in the scope, don't get a token, end of story. With global tokens we are going to end up in situations when token works in RegionOne and doesn't work in RegionTwo, for unknown reason even if nothing has changed.

It will also require clear understanding of difference of scope for token _users_. They will have to be explained that "no, you cannot do that with your federated token, because you can do that only with your project-scoped token".

TL;DR: tokens no longer have the same functionality, their functionality is defined by scope now.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2016-12-02 15:28:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-2

Agree with Breton.  This coupled with Fernet tokens has the potential to really lock things up.  Please focus on synchronizing the project database between remote sites, and not do it via the API.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2016-12-05 19:53:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

One suggestion on the uuid validation pattern. Otherwise the implementation looks good (without taking into consideration the discussion). This will need tests, and preferably API reference changes proposed *before* hand.'}, {'account_id': 12000, 'date': '2016-12-05 20:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

The commit message needs updating to explain the *whys* of this change'}, {'account_id': 7725, 'date': '2016-12-05 21:19:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14374, 'date': '2016-12-05 21:55:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

ayoung- 

Ensuring the project id is the same via db replication seems the same as being able to use the API  to achieve the same end?   The result it different keystone db's with the same project id's    

Using the DB to do this always feels like a hack.  Part of what I love about OpenStack is the commitment to the service layer.   Where if there is a valid use case then the API should support it.  I feel there are valid use cases for this feature and solving it by hacking the product I feel is not the correct path.

My Company use case is to have many regions, that have their own keystones.  However we have one CMDB, Show Back, and reporting systems.  They understand a single ID per project.  Therefore if a project is in 2 regions it would be very helpful if they have the same ID's

Please re-consider your -2"}, {'account_id': 7725, 'date': '2016-12-05 22:09:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

@Charles: are both sides writable? If so how would we resolve name and/to clashes?'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2016-12-12 22:24:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

I think this is spec-level work that needs substantial revisions to the API documentation before an implementation can be seriously considered.

I'd also suggest phrasing the use case some other way, because it reads as a solution to me, rather than as a concrete problem with keystone's existing horizontal scalability. Perhaps sharing a benchmark illustrating the intended benefits would also be advisable before any of this lands?"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-04-12 23:19:06.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I believe this is superseded by http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/stein/explicit-domains-ids.html and https://review.openstack.org/612099. The bug has been marked invalid and there has been no activity on this patch in over 2 years, so I'm administratively abandoning it. Feel free to restore if you think this deserves more discussion."}]

subject: Release manila 5.1.0 for stable/pike
messages:
[{'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-04-05 09:53:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-04-05 09:57:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

This would release the backport under discussion here [1] so if it is decided that we should revert it we need to push the change to revert and bump the SHA with that change before merging this.  I'll W-1 this until people have had time to consider.

My own position on this issue is still that the backport is legitimate and makes the best of a bad situation.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/004275.html"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-09 20:03:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Since it doesn't break anything. I'm okay with including the change [1]. However, we should be more careful in modifying configuration options in stable branches in the future. The vendor in question fixed a major bug with their driver in [1], and is relying on the fix elsewhere in the build tooling [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/645129/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-manila/blob/011d623a50fa02bbc4f3e41f21ffdaa7ee55e1b5/manifests/backend/dellemc_vmax.pp#L42 (stable/pike puppet-manila)"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-04-10 01:06:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@goutham: If we should be more careful modifying configuration options in stable branches in the future then I'd appreciate a reply on the openstack-discuss thread on the subject explaining exactly what we should have done instead.  The last email in that thread [1] explains that the backport introduces no bug (as you say, it doesn't break anything) and makes the best of a lousy situation.  No one is arguing that the original commit that made the lousy situation was a good thing but IMO it is that kind of commit, not the stable/branch backport, that we need to be more careful about.

I'm pressing the point because it is possible that I'm missing something here but I don't see that you or tonyb have explained what it is yet :)"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-12 01:17:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I'm pressing the point because it is possible that I'm missing something here but I don't see that you or tonyb have explained what it is yet :)

Hi Tom: I already noted what I think is wrong in my initial response in the email [3]. I called adding new deprecations in an older release a "bug"; it could be a matter of perception. I did acknowledge in our conversations that nothing is going to break in an environment because of the change in question. 

[4] is a copy of the generated config file before the change in stable/pike and [5] is the same after the change. I don't understand the reasoning for introducing these unrelated deprecations.

[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/004287.html
[4] http://paste.openstack.org/show/749220/  
[5] http://paste.openstack.org/show/749219/'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-12 04:16:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I *think* I'm okay with this based on the discussion on the list.

I have a late question to clarify, assuming I'm right I'll +2 this"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-04-12 13:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-04-12 13:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I don't understand the reasoning for introducing these unrelated deprecations.

Doing it this way makes all the EMC models work "the same way" from ocata forwards which seems to me to conform to the principle of least surprise in that it avoids having support cases opened because end users try to consistently use the non-model-specific options, the way they would with other models, and support has to explain to them that only one of these options works.  So it seemed to me reasonable and simpler to have all the models work "the same way" and get the message out that although the non-model-specific options work, they are deprecated and users should migrate off of them, no matter what EMC model they are using for manila.

But I think I'm repeating myself and we can agree to disagree on this one.  I was just resisting the statement that "we should be more careful" since additional care doesn't change my opinion on this one :)'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-04-12 13:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-12 16:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-12 16:11:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2019-04-12 17:43:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2019-04-12 18:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-12 22:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 16:21:21.000000000', 'message': 'Delete constraints and requirements files on build fail

If the installation of Python packages fails for any reason, the
constraint and requirements file is already written and therefore
unless you delete the virtualenv, it would not rebuild things
again.

This patch will handle failure and delete those files, then provide
a warning for the user upon failing to inspect the needed file.

Closes-Bug: #1824189

Change-Id: I67db44ce10250908f23c26c90d271a780a875eb6
'}]
commit_message:
Delete constraints and requirements files on build fail

If the installation of Python packages fails for any reason, the
constraint and requirements file is already written and therefore
unless you delete the virtualenv, it would not rebuild things
again.

This patch will handle failure and delete those files, then provide
a warning for the user upon failing to inspect the needed file.

Closes-Bug: #1824189

Change-Id: I67db44ce10250908f23c26c90d271a780a875eb6

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 16:20:40.000000000', 'message': "Add shade and osc functional jobs to devstack pipelines

python-openstackclient and shade both have and gate on new-style
devstack jobs. They currently have cargo-culted functional test base
jobs, but should shift to the functional test base jobs from the last
patch. They each serve as good test cases to make sure the base jobs
don't break. osc will use devstack-tox-functional and shade will use
devstack-tox-functional-consumer.

commit_message:
Add openstacksdk functional job to devstack pipelines

openstacksdk gates on the new-style devstack functional base jobs. It
serves as a good test case to make sure the functional base jobs don't
break.

Change-Id: I817639ed30cda8ea51d156872a14bbcf10a4e63d

commit_message:
stack.sh: Clear OpenStack related envvars

stack.sh usually fails when it is started in a shell session
where OpenStack related environment variables OS_* are set.
Most common failure scenarios are failures in keystone operations.

This commits clears OpenStack related environment variables
at the begining of stack.sh.

Change-Id: I3a924a0586dc9bb28f3bf3e151e100c24015efe5

commit_message:
Make it possible to send sensor data for all nodes

Presently the data collection defaults to only permit
sensor data to be collected and transmitted as notifications
for instances deployed via nova, however standalone operators
or general data center operators may find the sensor data
useful to identify undeployed failing hardware and overall
check the hardware health.

Adds a boolean to control the filter being set for a deployed
node.

Change-Id: I345f6e3a9f47d8d09ea488d64927fd0c5fb7dfc7

the outcome of the keystone meeting on 7/5/2016 was that this spec raises some very good points about the lack of full RBAC support in keystone. It will not however make the target for newton, as it's a fairly huge change. It does warrant further discussion, I'd like to see something related to this topic land in Ocata and perhaps a way to stagger the changes in case there's some slippage"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2016-07-06 12:47:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

From an outsider perspective, and as someone who would likely be involved on the Nova side of this, can more details be added as to what benefit this provides to users and consuming projects. This spec expresses a feeling that moving RBAC to keystone is the right thing to do, but it's not at all clear to me why that's the right thing to do."}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2016-07-12 20:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-06-03 14:23:29.000000000', 'message': 'Complete RBAC in keystone

This spec proposes to perform all needed access control checks in keystone
rather than separate the process into:
- policy enforcement performed by every service using oslo.policy
- delegation(assignment) management done by keystone

Implements bp complete-rbac

Change-Id: Iaee3c2a02c91a40cd725da807cc3fef5192f2b94
'}, {'created': '2016-06-20 18:45:54.000000000', 'message': 'Complete RBAC in keystone

This spec proposes to perform all needed access control checks in keystone
rather than separate the process into:
- policy enforcement performed by every service using oslo.policy

commit_message:
Complete RBAC in keystone

This spec proposes to perform all needed access control checks in keystone
rather than separate the process into:
- policy enforcement performed by every service using oslo.policy
- delegation(assignment) management done by keystone

Implements bp complete-rbac

Change-Id: Iaee3c2a02c91a40cd725da807cc3fef5192f2b94

commit_message:
Stop iscsid when running FFU tasks.

iscsid service should not be running on the host after upgrading to queens.
The THT tasks for doing this are missing.

stable/queens only fix

Change-Id: Ie459c8c03e03dab0df657e3f6514435457ede155
Closes-bug: 1821600

subject: Integrate oslo.config validator
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 7037, 'name': 'John Perkins', 'email': 'john.perkins@rackspace.com', 'username': 'JPerkins'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 19611, 'name': 'Brian Stajkowski', 'email': 'brian.stajkowski@rackspace.com', 'username': 'ski'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7037, 'date': '2017-01-27 21:47:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-01-27 22:05:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I am really against copy and pasting python code into /tools. THe limited tools here are really find overall, but python can be installed/run/etc in a number of ways. I am not happy we're adding more things that are copy/paste here. Please do not do it like this."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-01-27 22:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-01-27 22:08:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sorry for the quick -2 here. This is something we've worked *very* hard to limite/eliminate within our code base and I don't want us to roll back too far."}, {'account_id': 19611, 'date': '2017-01-27 22:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can you elaborate here?'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2017-01-27 22:37:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

without running the validator on every change, whats the point? things will just bit-rot.

also, i'm weary about useful this will be. we push a change once in a while (usually again at the end of the cycle) that updates the sample keystone.conf. the sample is generated using `tox -e genconfig` (which uses oslo.config config generator), so i'm unsure how we would ever introduce something that is invalid."}, {'account_id': 7037, 'date': '2017-01-27 22:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Steve: this is for operators to validate their config after manual changes but before deployment, not for devs changing the samples.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-27 23:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-keystone-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-keystone-docs-ubuntu-xenial/fa8014c//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 40s
- gate-keystone-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-keystone-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/dd3f360/ : SUCCESS in 2m 48s
- gate-keystone-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-keystone-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial/ffde4a8/ : SUCCESS in 8m 38s
- gate-keystone-python35-db http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-keystone-python35-db/e412a5c/ : SUCCESS in 7m 33s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-trusty http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-trusty/c61f768/ : SUCCESS in 1h 05m 01s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial/8147ba7/ : SUCCESS in 57m 15s
- gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-xenial/fd7ba1d/ : SUCCESS in 49m 25s
- gate-keystoneclient-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-keystoneclient-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial-nv/84e8ab0/ : SUCCESS in 26m 22s (non-voting)
- gate-keystone-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-keystone-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial/9fc4691/ : SUCCESS in 18m 24s
- gate-keystone-dsvm-functional-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-keystone-dsvm-functional-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv/9d39685/ : SUCCESS in 29m 59s (non-voting)
- gate-keystone-dsvm-py35-functional-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-keystone-dsvm-py35-functional-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv/9cfc9e4/ : SUCCESS in 27m 55s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-keystone-uwsgi-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-keystone-uwsgi-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/3ed1386/ : SUCCESS in 1h 25m 39s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/6725c36/ : SUCCESS in 55m 34s (non-voting)
- keystone-coverage-db-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/08/426408/1/check/keystone-coverage-db-ubuntu-xenial/a1ab7ef/ : SUCCESS in 8m 39s'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2017-01-30 06:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> @Steve: this is for operators to validate their config after manual
 > changes but before deployment, not for devs changing the samples.

OK, cool. So an operator would run `keystone-config-check`, and `nova-config-check`, etc, wherever they deploy a service ?

Why not run oslo-config-check --input-file <path-to-config> instead?'}, {'account_id': 7037, 'date': '2017-01-30 15:25:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Steve: Running the validator via the oslo.config CLI entry point is an option for every project. Here's the full command for validating keystone:

$ oslo-config-validator --namespace keystone --namespace oslo.cache --namespace oslo.log --namespace oslo.messaging --namespace oslo.policy --namespace oslo.db --namespace oslo.middleware --namespace osprofiler --ignore-namespace os_inherit --input-file <the file>

If the keystone team wants to do it that way, I have no objections."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-01-30 17:39:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So, the tools wouldn't be installed *anyway*, we may want to create an actual entry point that does the wrapping for that validator (shell cmd?) as you outlined. I def. don't want this in /tools if it is expected to be used outside of unit tests (CI/Gate).

I'll rescind my -2 if we have it installed cleanly/in a place like keystone-manage is *and* we have unit tests to ensure it isn't broken.

I understand what you;re going for and a helper script is totally worth-while, just not where it currently is :)"}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-02-02 19:47:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

this is going to be difficult to make available for operators as config-generator is not available when keystone is installed.

this needs work before we can include it, but it hsoul dbe added as a command to keystone-manage... however that will work.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2017-03-01 17:41:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Continuing along the lines of Morgan's suggestion, can this just be additional output from `keystone-manage doctor`? I'm not sure I see any reason to introduce a separate command, especially outside of *-manage. I'd like to hear from the other project's on this point as well."}, {'account_id': 7037, 'date': '2017-03-01 17:56:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Dolph: Thanks for the in-depth reviews. I'll try porting this to be keystone-manage doctor output after I've fully addressed your main validator CR."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2017-03-01 18:04:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Lifting my -2 and knocking it back to -1 since John is porting it to keystone-manage doctor commands :)

Thanks John!'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-03-01 19:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is there a patch in the work for adding this to `keystone-manage doctor`? If so, can we abandon this approach in favor of that one?'}, {'account_id': 17860, 'date': '2017-06-04 01:06:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Any updates here? I like the intent of this patch.

I see the patch in oslo.config is under review yet. Echoing Dolph's suggestions, please update this to follow the keystone doctor approach."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-07-17 21:34:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> Any updates here? I like the intent of this patch.
 > 
 > I see the patch in oslo.config is under review yet. Echoing Dolph's
 > suggestions, please update this to follow the keystone doctor
 > approach.

++ I agree, looking forward to seeing the new revision."}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2017-10-06 01:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Steve Martinelli with the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Steve Martinelli <s.martinelli@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-04-12 21:12:26.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This hasn't seen an update in 2 years, so I'm administratively abandoning it. Feel free to restore if you want to pick it back up."}]

commit_message:
Enable audit pipeline for ceilometer

This change adds the keystonemiddleware audit paste filter[0]
and enables it for the ceilometer-api service. This provides
the ability to audit API requests for ceilometer.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/audit.html

Change-Id: I9d49769bc04f9623ecf5ba4276665dc3b5bebd07

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary GPG keys setting for YUM repos.

We add the GPG keys in the previous task so there is no need to
do this inside the YUM task, also, it breaks things because Ansible
expects this to be a string and it's getting a list.

Change-Id: I82f1095bd0e21d76d0246b0c22792878edfb44bf
(cherry picked from commit d0922e347d055fcf0abc2ef0f91605ad4f8d5c3e)

commit_message:
flatten the ovn service configurations

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for the ovn services.

Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening
Change-Id: I6261863c15f594fed8207ff258f1d9c809a9a864

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 13:37:27.000000000', 'message': 'Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change

commit_message:
Do not persist RequestSpec.ignore_hosts

Change Ic3968721d257a167f3f946e5387cd227a7eeec6c in Newton
started setting the RequestSpec.ignore_hosts field to the
source instance.host during resize/cold migrate if
allow_resize_to_same_host=False in config, which it is by
default.

Change I8abdf58a6537dd5e15a012ea37a7b48abd726579 also in
Newton persists changes to the RequestSpec in conductor
in order to save the RequestSpec.flavor for the new flavor.
This inadvertently persists the ignore_hosts field as well.

Later if you try to evacuate or unshelve the server it will ignore
the original source host because of the persisted ignore_hosts
value. This is obviously a problem in a small deployment with only
a few compute nodes (like an edge deployment). As a result, an
evacuation can fail if the only available host is the one being
ignored.

This change does two things:

1. In order to deal with existing corrupted RequestSpecs in the DB,
   this change simply makes conductor overwrite RequestSpec.ignore_hosts
   rather than append during evacuate before calling the scheduler so
   the current instance host (which is down) is filtered out.

   This evacuate code dealing with ignore_hosts goes back to Mitaka:

     I7fe694175bb47f53d281bd62ac200f1c8416682b

   The test_rebuild_instance_with_request_spec unit test is updated
   and renamed to actually be doing an evacuate which is what it was
   intended for, i.e. the host would not change during rebuild.

2. This change makes the RequestSpec no longer persist the ignore_hosts
   field like several other per-operation fields in the RequestSpec.
   The only operations that use ignore_hosts are resize (if
   allow_resize_to_same_host=False), evacuate and live migration, and
   the field gets reset in each case to ignore the source instance.host.

The related functional recreate test is also updated to show the
bug is fixed. Note that as part of that, the confirm_migration method
in the fake virt driver needed to be implemented otherwise trying to
evacuate back to the source host fails with an InstanceExists error since
the confirmResize operation did not remove the guest from the source host.

Conflicts:
      nova/objects/request_spec.py
      nova/tests/unit/objects/test_request_spec.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I53e5debcffd6de2b3a2ff838e7f5da33fa1a82b8 in Rocky which added
the requested_resources field to the RequestSpec object.

Change-Id: I3f488be6f3c399f23ccf2b9ee0d76cd000da0e3e
Closes-Bug: #1669054
(cherry picked from commit e4c998e57390c15891131205f7443fee98dde4ee)
(cherry picked from commit 76dfb9d0b6cee1bbb553d3ec11139ca99a6f9474)

[{'created': '2019-03-26 19:58:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix incomplete instance data returned after build failure

This change fixes a race in _cleanup_build_artifacts. We were updating
the instance mapping to point at the cell in which the instance was
created before the instance record was complete, i.e. before the related
BDMs and tags were created in the cell DB. Updating the instance mapping
exposes the cell's version of the instance to the API. If the API happened
to fetch it before it was finished being created it would return
incomplete data.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1820337
Change-Id: If966eb1161c842ff49aa530e4482dbca87b61a3e
(cherry picked from commit 64f6cbc9120e3c288f312eddc59452dee4998f93)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incomplete instance data returned after build failure

This change fixes a race in _cleanup_build_artifacts. We were updating
the instance mapping to point at the cell in which the instance was
created before the instance record was complete, i.e. before the related
BDMs and tags were created in the cell DB. Updating the instance mapping
exposes the cell's version of the instance to the API. If the API happened
to fetch it before it was finished being created it would return
incomplete data.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1820337
Change-Id: If966eb1161c842ff49aa530e4482dbca87b61a3e
(cherry picked from commit 64f6cbc9120e3c288f312eddc59452dee4998f93)

commit_message:
DVR: Correctly change MTU in fip namespace

The code that ensures the fpr/rfp veth pair exists
between the qrouter and fip namespace was only setting
the mtu of the devices if it had to create them.  Set
it all the time to support the mtu being changed.

Change-Id: I176b5f4d4f12cf09f930e2c1944e98082a09bcc6
Closes-bug: #1823798

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 18:38:33.000000000', 'message': "Add option to disable using oslo_message notifier

Add a configuration option, 'use_oslo_messaging', to indicate whether
to use oslo_messaging notifier. It is set to true for backwards
compatibility.
We can't use audit middleware with services like Swift, which have no
dependency on Oslo and does not work well with oslo_log. Swift uses rsyslog.
Currently, audit middleware indiscriminately chooses oslo_messaging if the
package is installed. This is problematic if Swift proxy is on the same
controller as any service which consumes oslo_messaging. With this new option,
Swift can now safely consume audit middleware by electing to use local
log notifier instead of oslo_messaging.

Change-Id: I87bf857c20e4b78e97d40dcc51a1b4ff0014abb2
Closes-Bug: #1695038
(cherry picked from commit e83bd0bc3c7973e45b677c1c7007770e3f4873b4)
"}]
commit_message:
Add option to disable using oslo_message notifier

Add a configuration option, 'use_oslo_messaging', to indicate whether
to use oslo_messaging notifier. It is set to true for backwards
compatibility.
We can't use audit middleware with services like Swift, which have no
dependency on Oslo and does not work well with oslo_log. Swift uses rsyslog.
Currently, audit middleware indiscriminately chooses oslo_messaging if the
package is installed. This is problematic if Swift proxy is on the same
controller as any service which consumes oslo_messaging. With this new option,
Swift can now safely consume audit middleware by electing to use local
log notifier instead of oslo_messaging.

Change-Id: I87bf857c20e4b78e97d40dcc51a1b4ff0014abb2
Closes-Bug: #1695038
(cherry picked from commit e83bd0bc3c7973e45b677c1c7007770e3f4873b4)

commit_message:
Pin proliantutils version

This avoids an issue where the version installed could be incompatible
with ironic, or other installed libraries.

In particular, this was seen with proliantutils 2.8.2, which is
incompatible with the version of sushy-lib on the stable/rocky branch.

Change-Id: I02f1e247ca2333b2e90586e7311395e7bd94938c
Story: 2005310
Task: 30214
(cherry picked from commit 348b45aca8dc850840b3a3b656a6a8fc8f99bf47)

commit_message:
Pin proliantutils version

Change from master: pinned to <2.8.0 rather than 2.9.0.

This avoids an issue where the version installed could be incompatible
with ironic, or other installed libraries.

In particular, this was seen with proliantutils 2.8.2, which is
incompatible with the version of sushy-lib on the stable/rocky branch.

Change-Id: I02f1e247ca2333b2e90586e7311395e7bd94938c
Story: 2005310
Task: 30214
(cherry picked from commit 348b45aca8dc850840b3a3b656a6a8fc8f99bf47)

commit_message:
Split ibmc power/reboot classes

We've seen some fun things in the past with
the test runner and things like sleep getting
mocked in the background resulting in some odd
behaviors when multiple tests are iterating
and performing calls.

Since that is the case, and we've seen the ibmc
reboot test case sporatically fail, lets try
splitting the reboot testing into its own test
class which results in a different runner thread
and some minor restructuring to limit variables.

Change-Id: I2051995cc7080ba42aedb57816ab8f63154c7f51

commit_message:
Revert "Disable fullstack job from gate and make it non-voting"

This reverts commit d33e5f5c17e66a95216fefcda1d161f9a4c1f779.

After bugs [1] and [2] are fixed, fullstack job got back to acceptable failure rates and we can make it again voting and gating.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1820865
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1820870

Change-Id: I6feaaf563df93096f063e487a3ed086b93adcb0e
(cherry picked from commit 699bb45a6c514285b22c02e0aa3751795309af58)

Improve devstack vagrantfile

(2 comments)

Several rst formatting issues in the docs. Also not clear this is something that should be backported. Doesn't help that the original patch was self approved."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-11 17:02:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Also not clear this is something that should be backported. Doesn't help that the original patch was self approved.

Definitely agree."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-04-11 20:41:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

(2 comments)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Several rst formatting issues in the docs. Also not clear this is
 > something that should be backported. Doesn't help that the original
 > patch was self approved.

This patch failed to get attention from other team members and the community who are not interested in such change, as the PTL, i have to merge it myself to not block other patches. At the same time, some users were complaining the current trove image build approach, which could be improved with this patch.

If self approved is something you disagree, I'd appreciate if you could offer some help for the review."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-11 20:43:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-04-11 20:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-12 02:03:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There are a number of issues with this patch the Sean and Matt have pointed out.  They should be fixed on master not as part of this review.

I can see why consumers would want this but it missed stein.  To my way of thinking this is a policy violation and shouldn't be approved on stable/stein.  There may be mitigating circumstances, if so they need to be clearly called out to aid in the risk assessment by the stable team.

Ultimately the stable team and policy exists to ensure that stable releases stay stable *for consumers* it's a balancing act."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-04-12 02:15:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2019-04-12 17:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FTR Trove has stable:follows-policy tag in openstack/governance/reference/projects.yaml
and could drop it if the project decides so
e.g. TripleO did that when they wanted to push changes on stable branches which were outside the stable policy[1]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html'}]

commit_message:
Improve trove guest agent image building

- Add a new element 'guest-agent' for image building. This element is
  used when dev_mode=false, so that the trove code is downloaded into
  the image during the building phase rather than during the guest
  agent initialization.
- Improve trovestack sub-command 'build-image'.

  ./trovestack build-image ${datastore_type} \
     ${guest_os} \
     ${guest_release} \
     ${dev_mode}

- Improve documentation.

Story: #2005387
Task: #30375

Change-Id: I9d7acbd6a97f8c01b48b0f2cf94398d549d89124
(cherry picked from commit 798af4d02a089ac2dd29b4d66fcd47186fb7342b)

commit_message:
Add checking mechanism driver during upgrade

Add checking of mechanism driver during prep upgrade.
Prevent upgrading a stack to a version of tripleo templates or
environment that specifies neutron mechanism drivers that are
incompatible with the existing stack.

Change-Id: Ia6085ca63de0d8c48ab9c5b5811f6ac3e5141c85
Closes-Bug: #1823042
(cherry picked from commit 0041ec4c54088f32994a2cdc7846ff0a6c46638c)

commit_message:
Add logger to Proxy object

It's good to be able to easily log things. Add a logger of the form
openstack.{service-type}. This will allow conceptual filtering
without too much heartburn.

Change-Id: I091cb0997eec47d995b6522a57030005ca224cbb

commit_message:
Move warn clause as a shell task option.

The warn clause should be included inside an args
subsection, otherwise the task will fail syntactically
with 'warn' is not a valid attribute for a Task.

Closes-Bug: #1824496
Change-Id: I217437c4d104475c8ea415dd178940c40264e0b0

[{'created': '2019-04-11 15:01:18.000000000', 'message': 'Make overcloud_config working with Python 3

Open and write the content from the file in Swift as bytes and in read mode,
otherwise Python 3 fails to open it as it comes as a string by default.

Change-Id: Ie6abc2e58cc7f349881f1315e3a56af9a6814791
Closes-Bug: #1824225
(cherry picked from commit ef0e50851536fee32f34ce8f4a8d88f4c39b7ada)
'}]
commit_message:
Make overcloud_config working with Python 3

Open and write the content from the file in Swift as bytes and in read mode,
otherwise Python 3 fails to open it as it comes as a string by default.

Change-Id: Ie6abc2e58cc7f349881f1315e3a56af9a6814791
Closes-Bug: #1824225
(cherry picked from commit ef0e50851536fee32f34ce8f4a8d88f4c39b7ada)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-05 20:51:18.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Microversion 1.21 support

Add support for member_of/aggregate-uuid when listing allocation
candidates. The choice of arguments intentionally mirrors those
used when listing resource providers, which means that the term
'member of' is not used.

This is a WIP for reasons:

* I haven't done the tests or release note yet.

* Microversion 1.24 [1] is going to make argument parsing in
  this area considerably more complex. Not for the computer,
  but the humans using the tool. For now we probably want to
  do what's here, to do the aforementioned mirroring, but
  if people have thoughts on the future, please share them.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/placement-api-microversion-history.html#support-multiple-member-of-queryparams

Change-Id: Iba3e31fec29e8e85aa2f6a4248f0a27d7373ba6d
"}, {'created': '2019-03-06 18:30:22.000000000', 'message': "Microversion 1.21 support

Add support for member_of/aggregate-uuid when listing allocation
candidates. The choice of arguments intentionally mirrors those
used when listing resource providers, which means that the term
'member of' is not used.

Note that microversion 1.24 [1] is going to make argument parsing
in this area considerably more complex. Not for the computer, but
the humans using the tool. For now we probably want to do what's
here, to do the aforementioned mirroring, but when we get to 1.24
we'll need some brains.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/placement-api-microversion-history.html#support-multiple-member-of-queryparams

Change-Id: Iba3e31fec29e8e85aa2f6a4248f0a27d7373ba6d
"}]
commit_message:
Microversion 1.21 support

Add support for member_of/aggregate-uuid when listing allocation
candidates. The choice of arguments intentionally mirrors those
used when listing resource providers, which means that the term
'member of' is not used.

Note that microversion 1.24 [1] is going to make argument parsing
in this area considerably more complex. Not for the computer, but
the humans using the tool. For now we probably want to do what's
here, to do the aforementioned mirroring, but when we get to 1.24
we'll need some brains.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/placement-api-microversion-history.html#support-multiple-member-of-queryparams

Change-Id: Iba3e31fec29e8e85aa2f6a4248f0a27d7373ba6d

commit_message:
Fix usage of satellite in organization mode

When satellite is used in organization mode, deployments were failing
due to a change on code return on subscription manager. This last will
generate an error any way so this is a bypass.

Tested on queen.

Closes-Bug: #1822725

Change-Id: I0dd65cc752a6bd94bec59f695e55aa85ef8f0192
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d80a956d7266b12c593060fa0a01ed997771a8ee)

commit_message:
Fix usage of satellite in organization mode

When satellite is used in organization mode, deployments were failing
due to a change on code return on subscription manager. This last will
generate an error any way so this is a bypass.

Tested on queen.

Closes-Bug: #1822725

Change-Id: I0dd65cc752a6bd94bec59f695e55aa85ef8f0192
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d80a956d7266b12c593060fa0a01ed997771a8ee)

commit_message:
Enable bionic/stein and disco/stein functional tests

Stein ceph packages no longer provide python-ceph; its not directly
used by the charm and the ceph-* packages have an appropriate
dependency on the underlying python{3}-ceph package for each
release of OpenStack and Ceph.

Closes-Bug: 1824154
Change-Id: Ibcec0142dbcff5509c7545f1bcc2d7d832b6d697

commit_message:
Enable bionic/stein and disco/stein functional tests

Drop explicit install of python-ceph; ceph-common has an
appropriate dependency on the required python{3}-ceph package
so this is not required, and breaks on Stein where Python 2
packages are no longer provided.

Closes-Bug: 1824154
Change-Id: Ia219258f73f038170bc5a070d562e499459fe246

commit_message:
deploy-steps-tasks: create /var/run/podman

Create /var/run/podman directory so we can configure Paunch to start
containers with PID files in this directory and not in /var/run.

It'll make PID files more easily discoverable for the operators.
A patch in paunch will be done to change the path of PID files but first
we need this one to create the directory, as libpod doesn't handle it.

Change-Id: Ib788fe78515860563be0c38eef510c01663d65d9

commit_message:

better CD targets now like gitea and the nameservers. Pivot to running
CD on these non puppet options.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-05 17:31:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for 1.19 microversion

The 1.19 microversion of placement adds support for the
generation parameter when setting aggregates on a resource
provider. The value is an integer generation, available
when listing or showing resource providers.

The new TestAggregate119 inherits from TestAggregate to
repeat the general validation it does, overrides those
methods which require a generation when using version
1.19, and adds two failure tests.

Change-Id: I74157998dd19d8a8d2b68d12ed3726aac11eb013
'}, {'created': '2019-03-06 18:30:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for 1.19 microversion

The 1.19 microversion of placement adds support for the
generation parameter when setting aggregates on a resource
provider. The value is an integer generation, available
when listing or showing resource providers.

If an earlier version is chosen, but a --generation arg
provided, an error is reported. Similarly, if not generation
is provided and the version is 1.19 or later, an error
is reported.

The new TestAggregate119 inherits from TestAggregate to
repeat the general validation it does, overrides those
methods which require a generation when using version
1.19, and adds two failure tests. One test in the super
class is adjusted so that it works as desired in both
classes and in both versions of Python (Python3 has
different behavor of a *args before kw args). I considered
changing the signature of base.resource_provider_aggregate_set
but that would have meant changes is several places.

Change-Id: I74157998dd19d8a8d2b68d12ed3726aac11eb013
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for 1.19 microversion

The 1.19 microversion of placement adds support for the
generation parameter when setting aggregates on a resource
provider. The value is an integer generation, available
when listing or showing resource providers.

If an earlier version is chosen, but a --generation arg
provided, an error is reported. Similarly, if not generation
is provided and the version is 1.19 or later, an error
is reported.

The new TestAggregate119 inherits from TestAggregate to
repeat the general validation it does, overrides those
methods which require a generation when using version
1.19, and adds two failure tests. One test in the super
class is adjusted so that it works as desired in both
classes and in both versions of Python (Python3 has
different behavor of a *args before kw args). I considered
changing the signature of base.resource_provider_aggregate_set
but that would have meant changes is several places.

Change-Id: I74157998dd19d8a8d2b68d12ed3726aac11eb013

commit_message:
Detect missing metric_id before passing through bytearray()

It is possible for a row in Cassandra to have a missing metric_hash
(shows as 'null' in cqlsh). This causes an ugly NoneType error
to be passed up to the user on the command line for
'monaca metric-list'.

Fix is to detect the missing value, log an error, and return the
row with None for the metric[id].

This commit is effectively the same as
commit Ie617932c6b12a6cfe441510e120bb77a3470b9cf but had
to be reworked to backport to stable/pike.

Change-Id: I51c935534062f7e18a5609830778052b6cc58adb
Story: 2005305
Task: 30194

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 01:40:25.000000000', 'message': 'Use the PUBLIC_BRIDGE for vxlan

The PUBLIC_BRIDGE parameter, for most multinode zuul jobs
defaults to br-infra in cases where native zuul configuration
is used.

However, this is not true for legacy jobs still using devstack-gate.

When jobs are invoked with devstack-gate, the bridge must be set
to match the devstack-gate scripting as zuul *does not* setup the
vxlan bridge for us. Devstack-gate does so.

Change-Id: I37bff3c4d930ada483690d0dea17cb9a64d51fd2
'}, {'created': '2019-04-10 14:10:55.000000000', 'message': 'Use the PUBLIC_BRIDGE for vxlan

The PUBLIC_BRIDGE parameter, for most multinode zuul jobs
defaults to br-infra in cases where native zuul configuration
is used.

However, this is not true for legacy jobs still using devstack-gate.

When jobs are invoked with devstack-gate, the bridge must be set
to match the devstack-gate scripting as zuul *does not* setup the
vxlan bridge for us. Devstack-gate does so.

Change-Id: I37bff3c4d930ada483690d0dea17cb9a64d51fd2
'}]
commit_message:
Use the PUBLIC_BRIDGE for vxlan

The PUBLIC_BRIDGE parameter, for most multinode zuul jobs
defaults to br-infra in cases where native zuul configuration
is used.

However, this is not true for legacy jobs still using devstack-gate.

When jobs are invoked with devstack-gate, the bridge must be set
to match the devstack-gate scripting as zuul *does not* setup the
vxlan bridge for us. Devstack-gate does so.

Change-Id: I37bff3c4d930ada483690d0dea17cb9a64d51fd2

commit_message:
Switch include to include_tasks or import_playbook

include is marked as deprecated since ansible 2.4[0]

Switch to include_tasks or import_playbook as necessary

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_module.html#deprecated

Change-Id: Id654f07d18269f621df203b0808b69a75b13bc12
Closes-Bug: #1792761

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/610378/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 00m 18s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:39:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hm.

I guess this is okay since we weren't failing any py3 tests before, which we would have been if we had something that we had spoofed to dict-hood by implementing has_key, but which didn't inherit from dict.

I'm guessing (but am too lazy to go verify) that we were doing ^ that at some point, but it was nixed in an earlier effort to get rid of has_key.

So I think I'm on board with this. But let's simplify further, since we can - see inline."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-11-30 07:40:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Python 3 compatibility: fix has_key

For Python 3.0, has_key() isn't supported already, it can be replaced with in.

Change-Id: Ia88590da6d4b21274f166de0e0703b44b0c4e06a

commit_message:
use include_tasks instead of include

include is marked as deprecated since ansible 2.4[0]

Switch to include_tasks or import_playbook as necessary

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_module.html#deprecated

Change-Id: I77547ab1718094e8f108443f9cbc4557501c7ed7

commit_message:
Remove the duplicated doc8 executa

the doc8 action run twice when run tox -edocs[1] and -epep8[2],
that's unnecessary, the ps to update it.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/networking-onos/blob/master/tox.ini#L59
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/networking-onos/blob/master/tox.ini#L76

Change-Id: Ic818e14dfe0ced010acf301d35d1d833e0948a3a
Closes-Bug: #1800574

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I26e33ebd69ba569c913a588648e223f121be513f

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iae425fafaeb335afdff74bc9b6001d5c880e5e17

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iae2cb476630fad31faa588939327d32b91a4de07

In particular, the hacking version pins down pep8/flake8 dependencies,
and couple of years ago the pep8 package was renamed to pycodestyle.
The newer hacking tempest uses already depends on pycodestyle,
and so are the checks in tempest, but old hacking used by

failing any pep8 job run.

Change-Id: I190f10eb1754d47b17ce9e660e9ca0cdba5bbbbc
"}]
commit_message:
Bump hacking version to tempest one

designate-tempest-plugin re-uses the hacking checks available
in the tempest code, but those are written with tempest's
test-requirements in mind.
In particular, the hacking version pins down pep8/flake8 dependencies,
and couple of years ago the pep8 package was renamed to pycodestyle.
The newer hacking tempest uses already depends on pycodestyle,
and so are the checks in tempest, but old hacking used by
designate-tempest-plugin was not installing it at all,
failing any pep8 job run.

Change-Id: I190f10eb1754d47b17ce9e660e9ca0cdba5bbbbc

commit_message:
Fix quota tests for static credentials

when running tempest tests with static set of credentials Tempest does
not create new tenants on the fly, and those pre-defined tenants may alreay
have configured quotas that are different from default project ones.

For quota tests to reliaby pass we need to store the original quotas in the
beginning of the test and update to them in the cleanUp phase instead
of deleting them (which resets them to the default ones).

Change-Id: Ia1de916a97fee81148976a5b9cb134e012af8e0c
Closes-Bug: #1800470

commit_message:
Add nodegroup list/show commands

This adds the commands needed to list and show nodegroups in a
cluster. Specifically the commands added are:

* openstack coe nodegroup list <cluster>
* openstack coe nodegroup show <cluster> <nodegroup>

Depends-On: I5607c27eb0e84677acda29af006335374b60dd27
Change-Id: I910c7c7caff34aba2ce08ca5c9362403d11f324c

commit_message:
Fix the metavar on "resource provider aggregate set"

The "name" metavar is wrong since it is for the resource
provider UUID argument. This fixes the metavar to match
the argument.

Story: #2005446
Task: #30490

Change-Id: I1e9076a36c6cd27212bd76ee04307296fc937168

commit_message:
Update the min version of tox

In Train, we will use python3.6 and 3.7 for which the
minimum tox version required is 2.5[1]

[1] https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html#v2-5-0-2016-11-16

Change-Id: I84cc9535bdd10f378128f98b9821f1b67b07b6f4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-11 13:54:17.000000000', 'message': "Remove amp_hw_arch from octavia_post

This patch is a followup to this[1] change.

The reason for removing amp_hw_arch from octavia_post is:
1. In stable/queens, we break since we don't feed ansible with any value.
2. We don't support or ship an Amphora image that is non-x86_64. The purpose
of specifying the arch is (as stated here[1]) to hint the Nova scheduler
which compute nodes to take into account when it schedules an Amphora
instance.

[1] Ia7be6503a40e08d0d1f7f4d89132c9e9b5bd6704
Change-Id: I36a851397a0adeadc3216656c96c58f8668fd7fc

commit_message:
Remove amp_hw_arch from octavia_post

This patch is a followup to this[1] change.

The reasons for removing amp_hw_arch from octavia_post:
1. In stable/queens, we break since we don't feed ansible with any
value.
2. We don't support or ship an Amphora image that is non-x86_64.The
purpose of specifying the arch is (as stated here[1]) to hint the Nova
scheduler which compute nodes to take into account when it schedules
an Amphora instance.

Closes-Bug: #1824368

[1] Ia7be6503a40e08d0d1f7f4d89132c9e9b5bd6704
Change-Id: I36a851397a0adeadc3216656c96c58f8668fd7fc

version Queens.

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to pip

calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

This patch is a stable only, as tox_install.sh is only used up to
version Queens.

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to pip
version 10 introduced some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to
pip.

Change-Id: I9d80b52121a3448b91f1838c3961cc233749b610
